MIDFIELD data

CIP data

The midfieldr package includes cip, a tidy data frame with 1544 observations and 6 CIP variables of program codes and names at the 2, 4, and 6-digit levels. Each observation is a unique program. This dataset occupies 331 kb of memory.

The dataset format and variable definitions are described on the help page:

library(midfieldr)
?cip

midfieldr also includes collections of 6-digit CIP codes denoting groups of programs. To see the help page:

?named_series

Data packages

The MIDFIELD datasets, because of their size, are provided in separate data packages. All datasets are random samples of the MIDFIELD database.

  • midfieldstudent: student and degree data
  • midfieldcourse: course data
  • midfieldterm: term data

To install the data packages using the devtools package:

# data packages
devtools::install_github("MIDFIELDR/midfieldstudent")
devtools::install_github("MIDFIELDR/midfieldterm")
devtools::install_github("MIDFIELDR/midfieldcourse")

Student data

The midfieldstudent package provides student, a tidy data frame with 165 072 observations and 35 demographic variables. Each observation is a unique student. This dataset occupies 49.1 Mb of memory.

The dataset format and variable definitions are described on the help page:

library(midfieldstudent)
?student

Degree data

Also in the midfieldstudent package is degree, a tidy data frame with 89 886 observations and 14 graduation variables. Each observation is a unique student. This dataset occupies 10.1 Mb of memory.

The dataset format and variable definitions are described on the help page:

library(midfieldstudent)
?degree

Term data

The midfieldterm package provides term, a tidy data frame with 1.1 M observations and 22 academic term variables. Each observation is one term for one student. This dataset occupies 200.2 Mb of memory.

The dataset format and variable definitions are described on the help page:

library(midfieldterm)
?term

Course data

The midfieldcourse package provides course, a tidy data frame with 5.4 M observations and 17 academic course variables. Each observation is one course in one term for one student. This dataset occupies 735.1 Mb of memory.

The dataset format and variable definitions are described on the help page:

library(midfieldcourse)
?course
